page.title: 16A MOTHER'S DAY IN PLYMTREE
page.content: We try to get up at 0700. I'm 1st into bathroom. Husband Phil starts break- fast (laid the night before) while I dress Peter, age 4. Meanwhile Rachel, age 7, has wolfed breakfast & she runs to school, late again. Phil has gone to work & Peter & I finish our toast. I then walk Peter to Playschool half a mile away, calling at the village shop on my return. Home to Radio 4, to tidy the kitchen & bathroom, make beds & look for dirties. Another wash! Clean out & re-lay the fire. Collect Peter & often a friend at 1145. Snack lunch,TV then take children for a walk. Deposit friend & collect Rachel & friend from school. Prepare tea. Rachel goes to Chess Club & Phil is late. Children in bed by 2000. More washing-up! Collapse in heap for 30 mins before attacking the dreaded ironing. Bed at 2300, exhausted!
